label: Vercel API
description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the vercel API.

tools.name: AcceptProjectTransfer
tools.description:
Accept a project transfer request on Vercel.

    Use this tool to accept a project transfer request that has been initiated by another team on Vercel. This process requires a transfer code, which is generated by the initiating team. Call this tool when you need to finalize the transfer of a project to your team.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path, query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path, query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: project_transfer_code
parameters.description: The unique code of the project transfer request, required to accept the transfer.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the team to perform the request on behalf of.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The team slug used to perform the project transfer request on behalf of a specific team.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: AddEdgeConfigToken
tools.description:
Adds a token to an existing Edge Config.

This tool is used to add a new token to an existing Edge Config in Vercel. It should be called when you need to update the configuration with additional access or permissions via token.

parameters.name: edge_config_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Edge Config to which the token will be added.

parameters.name: token_label
parameters.description: A descriptive label for the token being added to the Edge Config.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier for the team on whose behalf the request is performed.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug identifying the Team on whose behalf the request is made. This is used for specifying the target team within Vercel.

tools.name: AddNewDomainVercel
tools.description:
Add a new apex domain with Vercel for the user.

    Use this tool to add a new apex domain name with Vercel for the authenticating user. This tool is not meant for transferring domains from external registrars to Vercel.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the Team on whose behalf the request is made.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The identifier for the team to execute the request on behalf of.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: AddProjectDomain
tools.description:
Add a domain to a specified Vercel project.

This tool adds a domain to a Vercel project by specifying the domain name and project identifier (id or name). If the domain is unverified, the response will indicate it needs verification. If the domain already exists, a 400 error will occur.

parameters.name: project_domain_name
parameters.description: The domain name to be added to the specified Vercel project.

parameters.name: project_identifier_or_name
parameters.description: The unique identifier or name of the project to which the domain will be added.

parameters.name: custom_environment_id
parameters.description: The unique custom environment identifier within the project.

parameters.name: git_branch_to_link_domain
parameters.description: The Git branch to associate with the project domain when adding it to a Vercel project. This allows the domain to be tied to a specific branch in the repository.

parameters.name: redirect_status_code
parameters.description: HTTP status code for redirecting the domain. Options are: 301, 302, 307, 308, or None.

parameters.name: redirect_target_domain
parameters.description: Specify the target destination domain to redirect to.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the team for which the request is made. This ensures the request is executed on behalf of the specified team.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the team to perform the request on behalf of. This identifies the team context for the domain addition.

tools.name: CheckDomainAvailability
tools.description:
Check if a domain name is available for purchase.

This tool checks the availability of a domain name for purchase, using the deprecated 'checkDomainStatus' endpoint from Vercel. Note that this endpoint has been replaced with 'Get availability for a domain.'

parameters.name: domain_name
parameters.description: The domain name you want to check for purchase availability.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the Team on whose behalf the request is performed.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug for the team or organization on whose behalf the request is performed.

tools.name: CheckDomainAvailabilityBulk
tools.description:
Check availability for multiple domains.

Use this tool to check if multiple domains are available for purchase. This can help in planning before acquiring domains via the buying endpoints.

parameters.name: domain_names
parameters.description: A list of domain names to check, with a maximum of 50 domains.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the team or organization associated with the request. It may be required to access specific domain availability data.

tools.name: CheckDomainTransferStatus
tools.description:
Retrieve the transfer status of a domain.

Use this tool to check the current transfer status of a specific domain, providing insights into progress or any issues.

parameters.name: domain_name
parameters.description: Specifies the domain name to check the transfer status for. It should be a valid domain string.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the team requesting the domain transfer status.

tools.name: CheckRemoteCachingStatus
tools.description:
Check the status of Remote Caching.

This tool is used to determine if Remote Caching is currently enabled, disabled, or disabled due to usage limits. It provides a quick way to verify the status of caching in Vercel.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the team to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The unique slug identifier for the team on whose behalf the request is made.

tools.name: CheckTeamAccessStatus
tools.description:
Check the status of a team access request.

Use this tool to check the status of a user's request to join a team on Vercel. The tool will return the status of the request or a 404 error if the request was declined. If no user ID is provided, it returns the status for the authenticated user.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the team whose access request status is being checked.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The ID of the user whose team access request status is being checked. Leave empty to use the authenticated user.

tools.name: ConnectIntegrationResourceToProject
tools.description:
Connect an integration resource to a Vercel project.

    This tool connects a provisioned integration resource to a specific Vercel project. It should be used when you need to establish a link between a resource and a project in Vercel.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path, query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path, query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: integration_configuration_id
parameters.description: The identifier for the integration configuration to be connected to the Vercel project.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: resource_id
parameters.description: The ID of the integration resource to connect to the Vercel project. This is required to establish the link.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the team to perform the request on behalf of.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: team_slug

tools.name: CreateAuthToken
tools.description:
Create a new authentication token for the user.

Use this tool to generate and retrieve a new authentication token for the currently authenticated user. Ensure to save the token for subsequent API requests, as it is only provided once.

parameters.name: token_name
parameters.description: A descriptive name for the authentication token. This helps in identifying the token's purpose or context.

parameters.name: expiration_timestamp
parameters.description: The expiration time for the token, specified as a Unix timestamp. This defines when the token will no longer be valid.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Team to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the Team to perform the request on behalf of. This identifies the specific team within your Vercel account.

tools.name: CreateCustomEnvironment
tools.description:
Create a custom environment for your Vercel project.

This tool creates a custom environment in a specified Vercel project, excluding 'Production' or 'Preview' as names. Use it to set up tailored project environments.

parameters.name: project_unique_identifier_or_name
parameters.description: The unique project identifier or project name for which the custom environment is being created.

parameters.name: branch_matcher_type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of branch matcher: 'equals', 'startsWith', or 'endsWith'.

parameters.name: copy_environment_variables_from
parameters.description: Specify the source environment to copy variables from. This is optional.

parameters.name: custom_environment_slug
parameters.description: Specify the slug for the new custom environment. It cannot be 'Production' or 'Preview'.

parameters.name: environment_description
parameters.description: Optional description for the custom environment being created.

parameters.name: git_branch_name_pattern
parameters.description: Git branch name or part of it to match with the custom environment.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the team to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the team to perform the request on behalf of. It is required to specify the unique team for the custom environment.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The Team slug to perform the request on behalf of. Provide the specific slug associated with the team.

tools.name: GetActiveAttackStatus
tools.description:
Retrieve active attack data from the Vercel firewall.

Use this tool to obtain information about any active attacks detected by Vercel's firewall within the specified number of days.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the project to retrieve attack data for.

parameters.name: active_days_since
parameters.description: Number of days in the past to look for active attack data. Defaults to 1 day if not specified.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the team to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the team to perform the request on behalf of. This identifies which team to target for the retrieval of attack data within Vercel's system.

tools.name: GetAuthenticatedUserInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve current authenticated user's information.

Use this tool to obtain details about the currently authenticated user from Vercel.

tools.name: GetCustomProjectEnvironments
tools.description:
Retrieve custom environments for a specified project.

Use this tool to get custom environments of a project on Vercel. These environments cannot be named 'Production' or 'Preview'.

parameters.name: project_id_or_name
parameters.description: The unique identifier or name of the project to retrieve custom environments.

parameters.name: git_branch_name
parameters.description: Specify the git branch to fetch custom environments from. This identifies the branch to retrieve environments for.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier for the Team to perform the request on behalf of. Expected as a string.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the team to perform the request on behalf of. This identifies the specific team related to the project.

tools.name: GetDeploymentAliases
tools.description:
Fetch aliases for a specific deployment by ID.

Retrieves all aliases associated with a given deployment ID. Use this to find or verify domain aliases linked to a specific Vercel deployment.

parameters.name: deployment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the deployment for which to list the aliases.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the team to perform the request on behalf of. It is required to retrieve deployment aliases.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug representing the team on whose behalf the request is made.

tools.name: GetDeploymentCheckDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve details for a specific deployment check.

This tool is used to obtain detailed information about a single check within a specified deployment. Use it when you need insights or results from a specific deployment check.

parameters.name: check_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the check to fetch details for.

parameters.name: deployment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the deployment for which the check details are required.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The identifier for the team on whose behalf the request is performed.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug identifier for the team to perform the request on behalf of. It uniquely represents the team within the system.

tools.name: GetDeploymentInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve deployment information by ID or URL.

Use this tool to get details about a Vercel deployment using either its ID or URL. This is useful for obtaining deployment specifics, especially when the user or team owns the deployment.

parameters.name: deployment_id_or_url
parameters.description: The unique identifier or hostname of the deployment to retrieve details for.

parameters.name: include_git_repo_information
parameters.description: Set to 'true' to include Git repository details or 'false' to exclude them.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the team on whose behalf the request is made.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The Team slug for performing the request on behalf of that team.

tools.name: GetDeploymentRuntimeLogs
tools.description:
Get logs for a specific deployment's runtime.

Use this tool to retrieve a stream of runtime logs for a given deployment in a project. This is useful for monitoring and debugging deployment processes.

parameters.name: deployment_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the deployment whose runtime logs are to be retrieved.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the project related to the deployment. This is necessary to retrieve the correct runtime logs.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the team to make the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The unique slug representing the team on whose behalf the request is made.

tools.name: GetDnsRecords
tools.description:
Retrieve DNS records for a specified domain name.

This tool fetches DNS records for a given domain. It returns up to 20 records by default, with additional records available through pagination.

parameters.name: domain_name
parameters.description: The domain name for which to retrieve DNS records. Must be a valid domain.

parameters.name: maximum_records_to_list
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of DNS records to retrieve in a single request.

parameters.name: records_created_after_timestamp
parameters.description: Get records created after this specified JavaScript timestamp. It filters DNS records based on the creation date.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the team to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug representing the team on whose behalf the request is made.

parameters.name: until_timestamp
parameters.description: Retrieve records created before the specified JavaScript timestamp.

tools.name: GetDomainAuthCode
tools.description:
Retrieve the auth code for transferring a domain from Vercel.

This tool is used to obtain the auth code needed to transfer a domain from Vercel to another registrar. It should be called when a domain transfer from Vercel is intended.

parameters.name: domain_name
parameters.description: The domain name for which the auth code is being requested. It should be a valid domain registered with Vercel.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The ID representing the Vercel team associated with the domain. Required for accessing team-specific domains.

tools.name: GetDomainConfiguration
tools.description:
Retrieve configuration details for a specific domain.

This tool calls the Vercel API to get the configuration settings for a given domain. It should be used when you need insights into the current setup or settings of a domain on Vercel.

parameters.name: domain_name
parameters.description: The name of the domain to retrieve configuration details for.

parameters.name: include_only_assigned_nameservers
parameters.description: When true, only nameservers assigned directly to the domain are included. When false, parent zone nameservers are included if no direct assignment exists.

parameters.name: project_id_or_name
parameters.description: The project ID or name associated with the domain, used if not yet linked to a project.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier for the team to perform the request on behalf of. It specifies which team's context to use when fetching domain configurations.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The Team slug used to perform the request on behalf of a specific team.

tools.name: GetDomainContactInfoSchema
tools.description:
Retrieve the schema for TLD-specific contact information.

Use this tool to get the necessary contact information schema required by specific TLDs for a domain. This is helpful when additional TLD-specific details are needed for domain registration or management.

parameters.name: domain_name
parameters.description: The domain name for which to retrieve the TLD-specific contact information schema.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the team within Vercel. Required to retrieve domain-specific contact info.

tools.name: GetDomainInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve information on a single domain from Vercel.

Use this tool to get detailed information about a specific domain associated with a Vercel account or team. This can be useful for managing domains or checking their configuration.

parameters.name: domain_name
parameters.description: The name of the domain to retrieve information for.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier for the team to perform the request on behalf of. Typically a unique string.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug identifier for the team on behalf of whom the request is made. It uniquely identifies the team in Vercel.

tools.name: GetDomainOrderInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve information about a domain order by its ID.

Use this tool to get detailed information about a specific domain order using its unique ID. It is useful for checking the status and details of a domain order processed through the registrar.

parameters.name: order_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the domain order to retrieve information about.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The ID of the team associated with the domain order. This identifies the specific team within Vercel that the domain order belongs to.

tools.name: GetDomainPrice
tools.description:
Retrieve domain price and purchase period details.

Use this tool to obtain the cost of purchasing a specific domain and the duration of a single purchase period, replacing the deprecated endpoint for domain price checking.

parameters.name: domain_name
parameters.description: The domain name to check the purchase price for.

parameters.name: domain_status_for_pricing
parameters.description: Specifies the domain status ('new', 'renewal', 'transfer', 'redemption') to check the price for.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The Team identifier for executing the request on behalf of a specific team. This is usually a unique string assigned to the team.

parameters.name: team_slug_for_request
parameters.description: The slug identifier of the team to perform the request on behalf of.

tools.name: GetEdgeConfig
tools.description:
Retrieve Edge Config details from Vercel.

Use this tool to obtain configuration details for a specific Edge Config in Vercel. It should be called when you need to access or review settings for an Edge Config using its unique identifier.

parameters.name: edge_config_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Edge Config to retrieve details from Vercel.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the team to perform the request on behalf of in Vercel.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the team to perform the request on behalf of in Vercel. This identifier is needed to specify which team's settings are being accessed.

tools.name: GetEdgeConfigBackups
tools.description:
Retrieve backups of an Edge Config.

This tool retrieves and returns backups for a specified Edge Config. It should be called when there is a need to access or review past configurations of an Edge Config managed by Vercel.

parameters.name: edge_config_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Edge Config whose backups you want to retrieve.

parameters.name: backup_limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of Edge Config backups to return. This is useful for paginating results.

parameters.name: include_metadata
parameters.description: Indicate if metadata should be included in the response. Use 'true' to include.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: A token for fetching the next page of results if pagination is needed.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier for the team on whose behalf the request is made.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The team slug to perform the request on behalf of. It identifies the specific team in Vercel.

tools.name: GetEdgeConfigItem
tools.description:
Retrieve a specific Edge Config Item by its identifiers.

Use this tool to get details of a specific Edge Config Item using its configuration ID and item key.

parameters.name: edge_config_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Edge Config to retrieve a specific item from.

parameters.name: edge_config_item_key
parameters.description: The key of the specific Edge Config Item to retrieve.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The ID of the team to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the team for which the Edge Config Item is requested.

tools.name: GetEdgeConfigItems
tools.description:
Retrieve all items from an Edge Config.

Call this tool to obtain all items within a specified Edge Config by providing the Edge Config ID. Useful for accessing configuration details stored in Vercel's Edge Config.

parameters.name: edge_config_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Edge Config to retrieve items from. This is required to specify which Edge Config data to access.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The Team identifier to perform the request for a specific Vercel team.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug representing the team on whose behalf the request is made. Each team has a unique slug identifier.

tools.name: GetEdgeConfigs
tools.description:
Fetch all Edge Configs from Vercel's service.

Use this tool to retrieve a comprehensive list of all Edge Configurations available in a Vercel account.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: Specify the Team identifier for which the Edge Configs need to be fetched.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The Team slug to perform the request on behalf of.

tools.name: GetEdgeConfigSchema
tools.description:
Retrieve the schema of an Edge Config.

This tool is used to obtain the schema details of a specific Edge Config by its ID. It should be called when there's a need to understand the structure or configuration of a given Edge Config.

parameters.name: edge_config_id
parameters.description: The identifier for the specific Edge Config to retrieve its schema. It is required to specify which configuration's schema you want to query.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the team to make requests on their behalf.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the team to perform the request on behalf of.

tools.name: GetEdgeConfigTokenInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve metadata about an Edge Config token.

Use this tool to obtain metadata for a specific Edge Config token by providing the edgeConfigId and token. Ideal for understanding token attributes and usage in Edge Config.

parameters.name: edge_config_id
parameters.description: The identifier for the Edge Config to retrieve metadata for. This is required to specify which configuration token's information is needed.

parameters.name: edge_config_token
parameters.description: The token used to obtain metadata for a specific Edge Config.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the team to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The Team slug for performing the request on behalf of a specific team.

tools.name: GetEdgeConfigTokens
tools.description:
Retrieve all tokens of a specific Edge Config.

This tool retrieves all tokens related to a specified Edge Config. It should be called when you need to access or manage tokens for an Edge Config identified by its edgeConfigId.

parameters.name: edge_config_id
parameters.description: A string representing the unique identifier of the Edge Config to retrieve tokens for. This ID is necessary to specify which Edge Config's tokens are being accessed.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The ID of the team to perform the request on behalf of. It identifies which team's Edge Config tokens to retrieve.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: Slug of the team to perform the request on behalf of.

tools.name: GetFirewallConfig
tools.description:
Retrieve the active firewall configuration for a project.

This tool is used to obtain the active firewall configuration for a specific project by retrieving the specified version of the configuration.

parameters.name: firewall_configuration_version
parameters.description: The deployed version of the firewall configuration to retrieve.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the project whose firewall configuration is being retrieved.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier for the team to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The team slug to perform the request on behalf of. It identifies the specific team by its slug name.

tools.name: GetIntegrationConfiguration
tools.description:
Retrieve configuration details by ID.

Use this tool to fetch the configuration details using a specific ID. The authenticated user or team must own the configuration to access it.

parameters.name: configuration_id
parameters.description: ID of the configuration to retrieve. The user or team must own this configuration.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier for the team on whose behalf the request is made.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The unique team slug to perform the request on behalf of a specific team.

tools.name: GetIntegrationResources
tools.description:
Retrieve all resources for a given installation ID.

Use this tool to get all resources associated with a specific integration installation. It requires the installation ID to fetch the relevant information.

parameters.name: installation_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the integration installation to fetch resources for.

tools.name: GetInvoiceDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve invoice details and status by ID.

This tool retrieves the details and status of an invoice using its ID. Use this when you need specific information about a particular invoice, such as its current status or other details.

parameters.name: integration_configuration_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the integration configuration. Required to specify the configuration context for the invoice retrieval.

parameters.name: invoice_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the invoice to retrieve details and status for.

tools.name: GetLastPromoteAliasesStatus
tools.description:
Retrieve aliases and their mapping status from last promote request.

Call this tool to obtain a list of aliases related to the most recent promote request, along with their current mapping status for a specified project.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Specify the Project ID to filter the promote aliases related to that specific project.

parameters.name: aliases_created_before_timestamp
parameters.description: Get aliases created before this epoch timestamp.

parameters.name: filter_failed_aliases
parameters.description: Set to true to filter results to only include aliases that failed to map to the requested deployment.

parameters.name: get_aliases_created_after_epoch
parameters.description: Get aliases created after the specified epoch timestamp.

parameters.name: max_aliases_to_list
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of aliases to list from the request. The maximum allowed is 100.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The Team identifier to perform the request on behalf of. Must be a string.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug representing the team to perform the request on behalf of.

tools.name: GetMemberRoleInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve member role and details for a specific member ID.

Use this tool to get the role and additional information for a member using their member ID. It is useful for verifying membership details and roles within installations.

parameters.name: integration_configuration_id
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the integration configuration. Required to specify which integration to retrieve member details from.

parameters.name: member_id
parameters.description: The ID of the member to retrieve role and details for. This corresponds to the "user_id" claim in the SSO OIDC token.

tools.name: GetProjectEnvironmentVariables
tools.description:
Retrieve environment variables for a specified project.

Use this tool to get the environment variables associated with a project by providing its `id` or `name`. Useful for managing and configuring project settings.

parameters.name: project_id_or_name
parameters.description: The unique identifier or name of the project to retrieve environment variables for.

parameters.name: caller_source
parameters.description: Specify the source making the API call.

parameters.name: custom_environment_id
parameters.description: The unique custom environment identifier within the project. Use this to specify a specific custom environment.

parameters.name: custom_environment_slug
parameters.description: The custom environment slug (name) within the project to filter specific settings.

parameters.name: decrypt_values
parameters.description: Set to 'true' to decrypt environment variable values. Use 'false' to keep them encrypted.

parameters.name: filter_by_git_branch
parameters.description: Specify the git branch to filter the environment variable results. Must have target set to 'preview'.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the team to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The Team slug to perform the request on behalf of. Use this to specify the team context for the request.

tools.name: GetProjectInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve specific project details using project ID or name.

This tool retrieves information about a specific project by using the project ID or name. It's useful for accessing project details from Vercel.

parameters.name: project_identifier_or_name
parameters.description: The unique project identifier or the project name to retrieve details.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the team to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The unique slug representing the team on whose behalf the request is performed.

tools.name: GetRegisteredDomains
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of registered domains for the user or team.

This tool fetches a list of domains registered under the authenticated user or team from Vercel. It is useful for managing or reviewing domain configurations.

parameters.name: domains_created_since_timestamp
parameters.description: Get domains created after the specified JavaScript timestamp.

parameters.name: maximum_domains_to_list
parameters.description: The maximum number of domains to include in the list returned by the request.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The unique Team identifier to retrieve domains for a specific team instead of the authenticated user.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The team slug used to perform the request on behalf of a specific team.

parameters.name: until_timestamp
parameters.description: Fetch domains created before this JavaScript timestamp.

tools.name: GetRollingRelease
tools.description:
Retrieve the rolling release for a specific project.

Use this tool to get details about a project's rolling release, including its current status (active, aborted, or completed). Useful when monitoring or managing project deployments.

parameters.name: project_id_or_name
parameters.description: The project ID or URL-encoded project name to identify the specific project.

parameters.name: filter_by_release_state
parameters.description: Filter the rolling release by its state: ACTIVE, COMPLETE, or ABORTED.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the team on whose behalf the request is made.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug that identifies the team on whose behalf the request is made. This is required for team-specific data access.

tools.name: GetRollingReleaseBillingStatus
tools.description:
Get the billing status for a project's rolling releases.

This tool retrieves the billing status for a specific project's rolling releases from Vercel. It determines if the project is eligible for configuration under rolling releases based on the team's billing status.

parameters.name: project_id_or_name
parameters.description: Project ID or name, URL-encoded, to identify the project for which to retrieve billing status.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier for the team to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug representation of the team to perform the request for. Used to specify which team's billing status is being queried.

tools.name: GetRollingReleaseConfig
tools.description:
Fetch the rolling releases configuration for a project.

Use this tool to obtain the template configuration for future rolling releases in a given project on Vercel. It does not provide settings for already active releases.

parameters.name: project_identifier
parameters.description: The project ID or name, URL-encoded, to identify the project for the configuration request.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Team on whose behalf the request is made.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug representing the team to perform the request on behalf of.

tools.name: GetSupportedTlds
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of TLDs supported by Vercel.

This tool provides a list of Top-Level Domains (TLDs) that are supported by Vercel. Use this tool to find out which TLDs can be managed or registered through Vercel's platform.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The ID of the team for which to retrieve supported TLDs.

tools.name: GetTeamInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve information for a specified team using teamId.

Use this tool to get detailed information about a team by specifying the teamId. It retrieves the data related to the team, which can include various details pertinent to the team specified.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the team to retrieve information about.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: A string representing the unique slug of the team. Used to specify which team's data to retrieve.

tools.name: GetTeamMembers
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of team members for a specified team.

Use this tool to get a paginated list of members belonging to a specific team by providing the team ID.

parameters.name: added_since_timestamp
parameters.description: Include team members added since this timestamp in milliseconds.

parameters.name: exclude_project_id
parameters.description: Exclude members belonging to the specified project using the project ID.

parameters.name: filter_by_team_role
parameters.description: Return members with the specified team role. Valid roles include OWNER, MEMBER, DEVELOPER, SECURITY, BILLING, VIEWER, VIEWER_FOR_PLUS, and CONTRIBUTOR.

parameters.name: include_members_until
parameters.description: Timestamp in milliseconds to include members added until this time.

parameters.name: member_limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of team members to return in a single request.

parameters.name: project_id_for_eligible_members
parameters.description: Include team members eligible for the specified project by providing the project ID.

parameters.name: search_team_members
parameters.description: Search for team members by their name, username, or email.

tools.name: GetTldPrice
tools.description:
Retrieve base price for a specific TLD.

Use this tool to get the base price for a top-level domain (TLD). It does not account for premium domain pricing. For specific domain prices, refer to a different endpoint.

parameters.name: top_level_domain
parameters.description: The top-level domain (TLD) for which to retrieve the base price. Examples include 'com', 'net', 'org'.

parameters.name: registration_years
parameters.description: The number of years for which the TLD registration price should be calculated. Provide this as an integer representing the duration in years.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The ID of the team for which the TLD price data is requested.

tools.name: GetUserTeams
tools.description:
Retrieve all teams for the authenticated user.

Call this tool to get a list of all teams the authenticated user is a member of, with pagination support.

parameters.name: max_number_of_teams
parameters.description: Maximum number of teams to return in the response.

parameters.name: teams_created_since_timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp in milliseconds to include only teams created since this time.

parameters.name: teams_created_until
parameters.description: Timestamp in milliseconds to filter Teams created until the specified time.

tools.name: GetVercelDeploymentFiles
tools.description:
Retrieve the file structure of a Vercel deployment.

Use this tool to get the file structure of a Vercel deployment by providing the unique deployment identifier. Useful for analyzing the contents and structure of deployed source code.

parameters.name: deployment_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the deployment to retrieve its file structure.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the team on whose behalf the request is made.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the team performing the request. It is required for team-scoped requests.

tools.name: GetWebhook
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a specific webhook using its ID.

Use this tool to obtain information about a specific webhook by providing its ID. It should be called when details are needed for a webhook managed by Vercel.

parameters.name: webhook_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the webhook to retrieve details for.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the team on whose behalf the request is made. Required to specify the team context.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug representing the team to perform the request on behalf of.

tools.name: ImportResourceToVercel
tools.description:
Import or synchronize a resource to Vercel.

    This tool is used to import or update a resource in Vercel's installation. It should be called when resources created externally need to be synchronized with Vercel.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: integration_configuration_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the integration configuration in Vercel. Required to specify which configuration to use when importing the resource.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: resource_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the resource to be imported or synchronized with Vercel. This ID is used to match the resource between the partner's system and Vercel's system.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: InitiateProjectTransfer
tools.description:
Initiate a project transfer request between teams.

This tool initiates a project transfer request from one team to another on Vercel. It returns a code valid for 24 hours, which can be used to accept the transfer via a specified endpoint or claim URL.

parameters.name: project_id_or_name
parameters.description: The ID or name of the project to transfer between teams.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the team initiating the project transfer.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The Team slug to perform the project transfer request on behalf of. This is a unique identifier for the team on Vercel.

parameters.name: webhook_callback_url
parameters.description: The URL to send a webhook to when the project transfer is accepted.

parameters.name: webhook_signing_secret
parameters.description: The secret key used to sign the webhook payload with HMAC-SHA256 for security verification.

tools.name: InitiateUserDeletion
tools.description:
Initiates user deletion and sends a confirmation email.

Use this tool to start the deletion process for a user by emailing a confirmation link. The user has to follow the link to complete the deletion.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.

Unpause a Vercel project using its project ID.

Use this tool to unpause a Vercel project by providing its project ID. The tool confirms successful unpausing or indicates failure if the project ID is invalid.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Vercel project to be unpaused.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier for the team on behalf of which the request is performed. Used to specify the target team in Vercel.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug identifying the team to perform the request on behalf of. Required for targeting the correct team's project.

tools.name: UpdateAccessGroup
tools.description:
Update metadata for an access group.

    Use this tool to update the metadata of a specified access group by its ID or name. This is helpful when you need to modify access controls or group settings.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path, query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path, query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: access_group_id_or_name
parameters.description: The ID or name of the access group to update. Use either the unique identifier or the group's name to specify which access group you want to modify.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the team on whose behalf the request is performed.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The identifier for the team, used to perform the request on its behalf.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: UpdateAccessGroupProject
tools.description:
Update an access group project in Vercel.

This tool allows updating the details of a specific access group project in Vercel. It should be called when modifications to an existing access group project are needed, such as changing roles or permissions.

parameters.name: access_group_id_or_name
parameters.description: Specify the access group by its ID or name to target the update.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the project to update in the access group.

parameters.name: project_role
parameters.description: Specify the project role to add to the access group. Choose from 'ADMIN', 'PROJECT_VIEWER', or 'PROJECT_DEVELOPER'.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the team on whose behalf the request is made.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the team to perform the request on behalf of.

tools.name: UpdateApexDomain
tools.description:
Update or move the apex domain configuration.

    This tool updates or moves the apex domain configuration. It is not used for updating auto-renew or nameservers, for which separate endpoints should be used.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path, query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path, query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: apex_domain_name
parameters.description: The apex domain to update or move. Accepts a string value representing the domain name (e.g., 'example.com').  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the team to perform the domain update on behalf of. This allows the request to be associated with a specific team.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug identifying the Team on whose behalf the request is made.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: UpdateAttackChallengeMode
tools.description:
Updates Attack Challenge mode setting for a project.

This tool updates the Attack Challenge mode setting for a project in Vercel's security settings. Use it when you need to enable or disable the Attack Challenge mode.

parameters.name: enable_attack_challenge_mode
parameters.description: Set to true to enable Attack Challenge mode; false to disable it.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the project to update the Attack Challenge mode for.

parameters.name: attack_mode_active_until
parameters.description: The UNIX timestamp indicating when the Attack Challenge mode should be active until. Specify this to control the duration of the mode being enabled.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the team on whose behalf the request is made.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The unique slug of the team on behalf of which the request is made.

tools.name: UpdateCustomEnvironment
tools.description:
Update a custom environment for a Vercel project.

Use this tool to update a custom environment in a Vercel project. The environment should not be named 'Production' or 'Preview'. Useful for managing project-specific settings.

parameters.name: custom_environment_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the custom environment within the project.

parameters.name: project_identifier_or_name
parameters.description: The unique project identifier or project name for the custom environment.

parameters.name: branch_matcher_type
parameters.description: Specifies the branch matcher type: 'equals', 'startsWith', or 'endsWith'.

parameters.name: branch_name_pattern
parameters.description: Specify a portion or full Git branch name for matching. Used to identify branches in custom environments.

parameters.name: custom_environment_description
parameters.description: Optional description of the custom environment to be updated.

parameters.name: custom_environment_slug
parameters.description: Slug of the custom environment to update. Must not be 'Production' or 'Preview'.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the team to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the team to perform the update on behalf of.

custom_environment_description.value: This environment is for feature development.

parameters.description: The domain for which you want to update the auto-renew setting. It should be a valid domain name, such as 'example.com'.

parameters.description: Set to true to enable auto-renewal of the domain, or false to disable it.

parameters.name: team_id

tools.name: UpdateDomainNameservers
tools.description:
Update the nameservers for a domain.

Use this tool to change the nameservers of a domain via Vercel. An empty array can be provided to revert to Vercel's default nameservers.

parameters.name: domain_name
parameters.description: The domain name to update the nameservers for. Provide the full domain, e.g., 'example.com'.

parameters.name: nameservers_list
parameters.description: A list of nameservers to set for the domain. Pass an empty list to revert to Vercel's default nameservers.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the team to which the domain belongs. If not provided, the default team context is used.

tools.description:
Update or disable rolling releases for a Vercel project.

Use this tool to update or disable rolling releases for a specific Vercel project. It changes the configuration for future deployments without affecting in-progress rollouts. Disabling the feature requires additional API calls to complete or abort current rollouts.

parameters.name: project_id_or_name
parameters.description: Project ID or name (URL-encoded) for updating rolling release settings.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier for the team to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug identifying the team for which the request is made.

tools.name: UpdateSecretsById
tools.description:
Update the secrets of a Vercel resource by ID.

    This tool updates the secrets for a given resource in Vercel, affecting connected projects with the new secrets. Note that existing projects using old secrets require manual redeployment to apply changes.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: integration_configuration_id
parameters.description: The ID of the integration configuration. This identifies the specific configuration in Vercel to update secrets for.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: resource_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Vercel resource whose secrets are to be updated.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: UpdateTeamInfo

tools.name: UpdateTeamMember
tools.description:
Update a team member's role or confirm membership.

    This tool updates a team member's details within a specified team, such as modifying their role or confirming an unconfirmed member's request to join. It requires the authenticated user to have 'OWNER' privileges in the team.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: member_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the team member to update.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the team where the member's role or membership status will be updated. It is required to identify the specific team.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: UploadClientCertToProject
tools.description:
Upload a client certificate for mTLS authentication.

    Use this tool to upload a client certificate to a Vercel project for mutual TLS (mTLS) authentication with external origins.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path, query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path, query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: project_id_or_name

tools.name: VerifyProjectDomain
tools.description:
Verify the status of a project domain's verification challenge.

This tool attempts to verify a project domain marked as `verified = false` by checking the correctness of its verification challenge. Use this to confirm domain ownership for a project.

parameters.name: project_id_or_name
parameters.description: The unique project identifier or the project name to verify the domain for.

parameters.name: verify_domain_name
parameters.description: The domain name you want to verify for the project.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The Team identifier to perform the request on behalf of. Provide as a string.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The Team slug used to perform the verification request on behalf of a specific team.

summary:
VercelApi is a comprehensive toolkit enabling developers to integrate with the Vercel API for efficient project and deployment management. It provides seamless access to various functionalities related to domain management, deployment operations, team collaboration, and environmental configurations.  

**Capabilities**  
- Manage project domains, environments, and associated configurations.  
- Facilitate user and team management within Vercel projects.  
- Accept project transfer requests and add members to projects.  
- Handle deployment operations, including creating, deleting, and promoting deployments.  
- Automate SSL certificate management and domain purchases.  

**Secrets**  
- The toolkit utilizes authentication tokens, such as the VERCEL_ACCESS_TOKEN, for secure API access.
